Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Install latest Neovim from GitHub releases for Linux systems

- Remove old repository-based Neovim installations on Debian/Ubuntu systems
- Download and install latest Neovim (v0.11.5) directly from GitHub releases
- Extract tarball to /opt and create symlink at /usr/local/bin/nvim
- Apply to both Debian and RedHat family systems

This ensures LazyVim compatibility by installing a recent Neovim version instead of outdated repository packages.

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Build Neovim from source and fix environment variable usage

- Replace local env lookups with remote ansible_env variables for correct user home/name detection
- Build Neovim from stable source instead of using pre-built binaries to avoid glibc compatibility issues
- Add build dependencies for both Debian and RedHat families
- Remove old installations before building to ensure clean state
- Apply build process to all Linux servers for consistency

This fixes GLIBC version errors on systems with older libc and ensures LazyVim is installed in the correct user directories.

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")
